00021 using namespace std;

00023 static const char Usage[] =
00024 "\n"
00025 "\n"
00026 "Usage: orcaroot [options] [input file(s) / socket host:port]\n"
00027 "\n"
00028 "The one required argument is either the name of a file to be processed or\n"
00029 "a host and port of a socket from which to read data. For a file, you may\n"
00030 "enter a series of files to be processed, or use a wildcard like \"file*.dat\"\n"
00031 "For a socket, the argument should be formatted as host:port.\n"
00032 "\n"
00033 "Available options:\n"
00034 "  --help : print this message and exit\n"
00035 "  --verbosity [verbosity] : set the severity/verbosity for the logger.\n"
00036 "    Choices are: debug, trace, routine, warning, error, and fatal.\n"
00037 "  --label [label] : use [label] as prefix for root output file name.\n"
00038 "\n"
00039 "Example usage:\n"
00040 "orcaroot run194ecpu\n"
00041 "  Rootify local file run194ecpu with default verbosity, output file label, etc.\n"
00042 "orcaroot run*\n"
00043 "  Same as before, but run over all files beginning with \"run\".\n"
00044 "orcaroot --verbosity debug --label mylabel run194ecpu\n"
00045 "  The same, but with example usage of the verbosity and mylabel options.\n"
00046 "  An output file will be created with name mylabel_run194.root, and lots\n"
00047 "  of debugging output will appear.\n"
00048 "orcaroot 128.95.100.213:44666\n"
00049 "  Rootify orca stream on host 128.95.100.213, port 44666 with default verbosity,\n"
00050 "  output file label, etc.\n"
00051 "\n"
00052 "\n";
00053 
00054 
00055 int main(int argc, char** argv)
00056 {
00057   if(argc == 1) {
00058     ORLog(kError) << "You must supply some options" << endl << Usage;
00059     return 1;
00060   }
00061 
00062 
00063   static struct option longOptions[] = {
00064     {"help", no_argument, 0, 'h'},
00065     {"verbosity", required_argument, 0, 'v'},
00066     {"label", required_argument, 0, 'l'},
00067   };
00068 
00069   string label = "OR";
00070   ORVReader* reader = NULL;
00071 
00072   while(1) {
00073     char optId = getopt_long(argc, argv, "", longOptions, NULL);
00074     if(optId == -1) break;
00075     switch(optId) {
00076       case('h'): // help
00077         cout << Usage;
00078         return 0;
00079       case('v'): // verbosity
00080         if(strcmp(optarg, "debug") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kDebug);
00081         else if(strcmp(optarg, "trace") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kTrace);
00082         else if(strcmp(optarg, "routine") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kRoutine);
00083         else if(strcmp(optarg, "warning") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kWarning);
00084         else if(strcmp(optarg, "error") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kError);
00085         else if(strcmp(optarg, "fatal") == 0) ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kFatal);
00086         else {
00087           ORLog(kWarning) << "Unknown verbosity setting " << optarg 
00088                           << "; using kRoutine" << endl;
00089           ORLogger::SetSeverity(ORLogger::kRoutine);
00090         }
00091         break;
00092       case('l'): // label
00093         label = optarg;
00094         break;
00095       default: // unrecognized option
00096         ORLog(kError) << Usage;
00097         return 1;
00098     }
00099   }
00100 
00101   if (argc <= optind) {
00102     ORLog(kError) << "You must supply a filename or socket host:port" << endl
00103                   << Usage << endl;
00104     return 1;
00105   }
00106    
00107   ORHandlerThread* handlerThread = new ORHandlerThread();
00108   handlerThread->StartThread();
00109       
00110   string readerArg = argv[optind];
00111   size_t iColon = readerArg.find(":");
00112   if (iColon == string::npos) {
00113     reader = new ORFileReader;
00114     for (int i=optind; i<argc; i++) {
00115       ((ORFileReader*) reader)->AddFileToProcess(argv[i]);
00116     }
00117   } else {
00118     reader = new ORSocketReader(readerArg.substr(0, iColon).c_str(), 
00119                                 atoi(readerArg.substr(iColon+1).c_str()));
00120   }
00121 
00122   if (!reader->OKToRead()) {
00123     ORLog(kError) << "Reader couldn't read" << endl;
00124     return 1;
00125   }
00126 
00127   ORLog(kRoutine) << "Setting up data processing manager..." << endl;
00128   ORDataProcManager dataProcManager(reader);
00129 
00130   ORLog(kRoutine) << "Starting output file writer..." << endl;
00131   ORFileWriter fileWriter(label);
00132   dataProcManager.AddProcessor(&fileWriter);
00133 
00134 
00135 
00136   //ADDITION FOR KATRIN - Start
00137 
00138   ORTrig4ChanShaperCompoundProcessor triggerShaperTreeWriter;
00139   dataProcManager.AddProcessor(&triggerShaperTreeWriter);
00140   
00141   //ADDITION FOR KATRIN - Stop
00142 
00143   ORLog(kRoutine) << "Start processing..." << endl;
00144   dataProcManager.ProcessDataStream();
00145   ORLog(kRoutine) << "Finished processing..." << endl;
00146 
00147 
00148 
00149   delete reader;
00150   delete handlerThread;
00151 
00152   return 0;
00153 }
